equipment.name: Primordial Binding
equipment.description: ‍Cir + ‍Ceh provides additional summons that Freeze enemies and apply Vulnerable. These also activate ‍Primordial Binding for mobility and Mana Regeneration.

equipment.name: Critical Strike Chance
equipment.description: ‍Gar provides additional Critical Strike Chance and is a great generic option.

equipment.name: Shocking Impact
equipment.description: ‍Tun triggers ‍Shocking Impact for a large burst of damage. This is the highest damage potential once you have enough ranks of ‍Shocking Impact and plenty of movement speed to replace ‍Qua.

equipment.name: Invocation Runes
equipment.description: ‍Tec for extra damage, with this you creates an earthquake and has the highest damage potential for early Invocation Runes.

equipment.name: Ritual Runes
equipment.description: ‍Yax and ‍Poc are other options for Ritual Runes.

equipment.description: Penitent Greaves - Grigoire, The Galvanic Saint

title: Heartseeker Rogue Leveling Build GuideBy dieoxide | Last Updated: September 22, 2025Season 10   Infernal ChaosLevelingRogue
Minion Barbarian Endgame Build GuideBy snail | Last Updated: September 23, 2025Season 10   Infernal ChaosEndgameBarbarian

equipment.name: Arreat's Bearing
equipment.description: Important: This build heavily relies on Arreat's Bearing in order to do any kind of meaningful damage. It is not recommended to play without first acquiring this item.The Starter variant of the Earthquake Barbarian Endgame Guide is a good place to start before transitioning to this build.

equipment.name: The Starter
equipment.description: The Starter variant of the Earthquake Barbarian Endgame Guide is a good place to start before transitioning to this build.

equipment.name: Each Torment
equipment.description: During early progression, Armor & Resistances should be prioritized in order to survive. Each Torment difficulty adds a penalty of -250 Armor and -25% to all Resistances and it's recommended to keep both capped at all times; this means having a value of 1,000 for Armor and 75% for each Resistance.

equipment.name: Ancestral Charge
equipment.description: Next, focus on the Summon and Ultimate-themed Aspects for their strong multiplicative damage boosts. Note that though some of these Aspects call out specific skills, they aren't required to be used to gain the damage bonus. They include:Ancestral ChargeAncestral EchoesApogeic Furor

equipment.name: Juggernaut's
equipment.description: Juggernaut's and Steadfast Berserker's are both extremely important, especially at this progression point. The former is very helpful for reaching Armor cap, while the latter is a worry-free way of keeping Fortify.

equipment.name: Vehement Brawler's
equipment.description: Vehement Brawler's is a good generic multiplier that also gives us +2 Ranks of Call of the Ancients.

equipment.name: Movement Speed
equipment.description: Hectic is useful early on to help reset all of our cooldowns, but Ghostwalker can be used instead for some extra Movement Speed.

equipment.name: Tuskhelm of Joritz the Mighty
equipment.description: Tuskhelm of Joritz the Mighty is a good choice at this progression stage as it offers us a ton of useful stats, as well as a pretty decent 1.35x damage multiplier from its Unique effect.

equipment.name: Mantle of Mountain's Fury
equipment.description: Mantle of Mountain's Fury gives us Earthquake explosions by using Hammer of the Ancients. This slot competes with Rage of Harrogath, but that item is more suited to being used as a Chaos Armor variant.

equipment.name: The Third Blade
equipment.description: The Third Blade is a good choice at this progression stage, purely for its ability to make Rupture a spammable skill. It's not needed later on, but for now, it makes the gameplay feel much smoother.

equipment.name: Sabre of Tsasgal
equipment.description: Sabre of Tsasgal is a weapon that encourages use of multiple damaging skills to maximize its effect; in our case, we have four such skills. The unnaturally high ranks of Warpath that are present on this item make it an even more valuable option in terms of pure offense.

equipment.name: Rage of Harrogath
equipment.description: Rage of Harrogath is a core part of the build and enables Rupture to constantly reset Call of the Ancients.Use the non-Chaos Armor version of this item in the Chest Armor slot (instead of Mantle of Mountain's Fury) if you don't have this. The ability to detonate Earthquakes for instant damage is lost, but the "tick" damage from them is still very strong.

equipment.name: Use the
equipment.description: Use the non-Chaos Armor version of this item in the Chest Armor slot (instead of Mantle of Mountain's Fury) if you don't have this. The ability to detonate Earthquakes for instant damage is lost, but the "tick" damage from them is still very strong.

equipment.name: Battle Trance
equipment.description: Battle Trance is the next priority, and it fits nicely into either the Boots or Gloves slot. This is a staple for most builds since it has the very powerful +% Strength stat, some Critical Strike Chance, and a strong damage multiplier from its Unique power. Not only that, it has an implicit that grants 30% Resistances to All Elements, making it a great defensive choice as well.

equipment.name: Fists of Fate
equipment.description: Fists of Fate (Chaos Armor) is the only new Unique addition, and it comes packed with a ton of great stats which are all useful to us in some way, especially Lucky Hit Chance (this should be the priority when masterworking). With high Lucky Hit Chance, Rage of Harrogath procs are much more frequent, making The Third Blade obsolete in most cases. This allows us to pick up Ancestral Charge and some more Earthquake Duration, both of which increase our damage significantly.

title: Poison Trap Rogue Endgame GuideBy mattias | Last Updated: September 23, 2025Season 10   Infernal ChaosEndgameRogue

equipment.name: Godslayer Crown
equipment.description: Godslayer Crown - Duriel, King of Maggots, Andariel

equipment.name: Scoundrel's Leathers
equipment.description: Scoundrel's Leathers - Duriel, King of Maggots, Andariel

equipment.name: Penitent Greaves
equipment.description: Penitent Greaves - Grigoire, The Galvanic Saint

equipment.description: Tal Rasha's Iridescent Loop - Echo of Varshan

title: Lunging Strike Barbarian Endgame Build GuideBy aoinomiku | Last Updated: September 26, 2025Season 10   Infernal ChaosEndgameBarbarian

equipment.name: Rage of Harrogath
equipment.description: Rage of Harrogath - Grigoire, The Galvanic Saint

equipment.name: Paingorger's Gauntlets
equipment.description: Paingorger's Gauntlets - The Beast in the Ice

title: Earth Spike Druid Endgame Build GuideBy boiler | Last Updated: September 21, 2025Season 10   Infernal ChaosEndgameDruid

equipment.name: Vasily's Prayer
equipment.description: Note that this midgame skill tree differs quite a bit from the endgame setups. Without access to Vasily's Prayer, Earth Spike cannot be used during Grizzly Rage. Instead, employ Petrify for a periodic Critical Strike Damage bonus and to reset all skill cooldowns. Blood Howl provides a short-lived but high-uptime Attack Speed bonus, while Earthen Bulwark grants extended Unstoppable when paired with Mending Stone. A Staff is preferable for now. Use Shred for traversal and to apply Poison to priority targets via Purge the Infected.

equipment.name: Paragon Board
equipment.description: Another key issue to highlight is in the Paragon Board. Because this variant does not have access to Vasily's Prayer or Shard of Verathiel, it cannot leverage either Survival Instincts or Ancestral Guidance. You can still utilize the first half of the board effectively with this setup, but the intent is that you graduate into the Ancestral variant before this becomes a concern. Make it a priority to farm Echo of Varshan for both of these items early into your Torment progression.

equipment.name: Each Torment
equipment.description: Early on in your progression, focus on Armor & Resistances to survive. Each Torment difficulty adds a penalty of -250 Armor and -25% all Res and it's recommended to keep both capped (1000 Armor, 75+ Res; 800 Armor, 50% Res with Brawn Over Brains) at all times. As you unlock higher power gear, masterworking levels and more Paragon points, you naturally scale your character into the higher difficulties and can start replacing some of these rolls with offensive or utility stats. In this Starter variant, Might can be exchanged for Disobedience or Juggernaut's if you still need additional Armor.

equipment.name: From the
equipment.description: From the time you reach Earthen Devastation in your Paragon Board, be mindful of your Damage to Crowd Controlled Enemies bonus. The target for this stat is 250%, and your personal value will depend on the nodes taken on this board, your Offensive Tempers, and the level of your Earth and Sky glyph. Over time, you'll be able to exchange Offensive tempers from Damage to Crowd Controlled Enemies for other Offensive tempers.

equipment.name: Core Uniques
equipment.description: Once you've acquired the Core Uniques for this build, you can transition to what is essentially the final version, with a skill tree, playstyle, and paragon board identical to those described in the main sections of this guide. The addition of Mythic Uniques and Chaos Armors from this point are more build-enhancing than build-enabling.

equipment.name: Insatiable Fury
equipment.description: Insatiable Fury is a powerhouse Unique for the Earth Spike Druid and is nearly on par to its eventual Mythic replacement. The stat line is amazing, but doesn't really warrant any gameplay changes. Acquire this Body Armour from Grigoire, the Galvanic Saint.

equipment.name: Grizzly Rage
equipment.description: As you're dependent on Grizzly Rage to cap Armor, make sure your Duration and Cooldown tempers afford you a generous overlap. Once you have that, feel free to use the remaining Offensive tempers on rolls such as Werebear Overpower damage and Resource tempers on Resource generation.

equipment.name: Brawn Over Brains
equipment.description: As you upgrade your gear to Ancestrals with more masterworking levels and reach higher paragon, you can focus more and more on replacing Armor & Resistance rolls with better stats, but be sure to stay capped (1000 Armor, 75+ Res; 800 Armor, 50% Res with Brawn Over Brains) for the difficulty you're currently in.

equipment.name: Fists of Fate
equipment.description: When it comes to incorporating Chaos Armors, make sure to never lose the effect of Vasily's Prayer. After that, your priorities are:Fists of Fate for a strong multiplier, additional Attack Speed, and Vulnerable application. Until you incorporate this, be sure to keep a roll of Lucky Hit: Chance to Inflict Vulnerable on your Gloves or Rings.Paingorger's Gauntlets for some great stats and to dramatically improve your clear speed.

equipment.name: Paingorger's Gauntlets
equipment.description: Paingorger's Gauntlets for some great stats and to dramatically improve your clear speed.

equipment.name: Shroud of False Death
equipment.description: As mentioned in the Ancestral section, Shroud of False Death and Insatiable Fury are about even with each other both Defensively and Offensively, and it's not a big deal if you don't have the Mythic. However, the former's extra rank to Passive Skills (particularly Provocation and Ancestral Fortitude) sets it apart, and the All Stats roll is helpful for capping Critical Strike Chance, Armor, and Resistances, as well as activating Rare Node bonuses in the Paragon board.

equipment.name: Movement Speed
equipment.description: Prioritize an Amulet with double Movement Speed rolls to try to cap.

equipment.name: Swap Cir
equipment.description: Swap Cir - Ohm with Bac-Jah for a high-uptime Teleport.

equipment.name: In Paragon
equipment.description: In Paragon, you can choose to incorporate Guzzler onto your Starter board in place of Headhunter. Technically, this is the highest damage Glyph available, but it requires you to maintain a low Potion count by selectively avoiding globes, manage the Healthy status, and simultaneously maximize uptime on Crazy Brew. This Glyph and playstyle are not recommended for general play, but it is a little extra damage if managed well.

title: Frenzy Barbarian Endgame Build GuideBy snail | Last Updated: September 24, 2025Season 10   Infernal ChaosEndgameBarbarian

equipment.name: Each Torment
equipment.description: During early progression, Armor & Resistances should be prioritized in order to survive. Each Torment difficulty adds a penalty of -250 Armor and -25% to all Resistances and it's recommended to keep both capped at all times; this means having a value of 1,000 for Armor and 70% for each Resistance.

equipment.name: Defensive Aspects
equipment.description: Next, focus on Defensive Aspects to make sure the Starter build doesn't just fall over.Juggernaut's and Steadfast Berserker's are both extremely important. The former is very helpful for reaching Armor cap, while the latter is a worry-free way of keeping Fortify.Might gives us some very welcome generic damage mitigation; it activates simply by attacking with Frenzy. Bul-Kathos is also an option here, but requires standing in Earthquakes periodically to function.

equipment.name: Juggernaut's
equipment.description: Juggernaut's and Steadfast Berserker's are both extremely important. The former is very helpful for reaching Armor cap, while the latter is a worry-free way of keeping Fortify.

equipment.name: Utility Aspects
equipment.description: To round out the build, we add some extra Offensive and Utility Aspects to fill out the rest of our gear.Edgemaster's gives us a damage multiplier based on our Fury pool (which is always full at this point).Rapid gives us some extra Attack Speed; this is useful early on as we don't have many good sources of this in the build quite yet.Anger Management gives us stress-free Berserking uptime.Bold Chieftain's helps keep all of our Shouts off cooldown.Accursed Touch gives us some early Vulnerable application. When this is no longer needed, it can be replaced with an Offensive Aspect, such as Elements.Lastly, Ghostwalker is used for some extra Movement Speed to help speed up the leveling process.

equipment.name: Edgemaster's
equipment.description: Edgemaster's gives us a damage multiplier based on our Fury pool (which is always full at this point).

equipment.name: Attack Speed
equipment.description: Rapid gives us some extra Attack Speed; this is useful early on as we don't have many good sources of this in the build quite yet.

equipment.name: Anger Management
equipment.description: Anger Management gives us stress-free Berserking uptime.

equipment.name: Bold Chieftain's
equipment.description: Bold Chieftain's helps keep all of our Shouts off cooldown.

equipment.name: Accursed Touch
equipment.description: Accursed Touch gives us some early Vulnerable application. When this is no longer needed, it can be replaced with an Offensive Aspect, such as Elements.

equipment.name: Movement Speed
equipment.description: Lastly, Ghostwalker is used for some extra Movement Speed to help speed up the leveling process.

equipment.name: Crown of Lucion
equipment.description: Crown of Lucion is an incredibly strong item that gives a ton of damage via its Unique effect, which occurs automatically by spending Fury.In order to for Basic Skills to be Fury spenders, Shard of Verathiel must be equipped. If you do not yet have Shard of Verathiel, use Tuskhelm of Joritz the Mighty or Ugly Bastard Helm instead.

equipment.name: Basic Skills
equipment.description: In order to for Basic Skills to be Fury spenders, Shard of Verathiel must be equipped. If you do not yet have Shard of Verathiel, use Tuskhelm of Joritz the Mighty or Ugly Bastard Helm instead.

equipment.name: Paingorger's Gauntlets
equipment.description: Paingorger's Gauntlets give us a ton of useful stats, including Basic Skill ranks, Attack Speed, and Cooldown Reduction. Its Unique effect makes all of our hits echo and then multiplies the damage, so long as we have a way to trigger it. In this setup, this is accomplished mainly by using Wrath of the Berserker and Ground Stomp. For more reliable activation, the Ceh Rune can be used as well.

equipment.name: Tassets of the Dawning Sky
equipment.description: Tibault's Will works in combination with Wrath of the Berserker to provide a decent damage boost, as well as a fairly high amount of damage reduction while Unstoppable.If Resistances are a problem, use Tassets of the Dawning Sky here instead..

equipment.name: Hooves of the Mountain God
equipment.description: Hooves of the Mountain God are what give Frenzy its ability to cleave in a small area in front of it. Many of the stats on this item are great, but ranks to Belligerence  should be prioritized first. When wearing these, Fury will constantly drain at an increasing rate until it is empty, at which point the draining effect resets. This is offset by the inherent Fury per Second that is present here, as well as other sources of Resource Generation and the natural ability of Basic Skills to generate Fury on their own.

equipment.name: Ramaladni's Magnum Opus
equipment.description: Ramaladni's Magnum Opus gives us a massive damage multiplier that is based on our Maximum Fury. For this reason, we prioritize this stat where it is convenient on gear and also via paragon points.

equipment.name: Shard of Verathiel
equipment.description: Shard of Verathiel gives us yet another massive damage multiplier, as well as some Basic Skill ranks and Maximum Fury. In general, the Basic Attack Speed stat on this item (which is also present on Hooves of the Mountain God) is not that important to focus on, since we naturally cap this Attack Speed breakpoint with almost no effort.

equipment.name: Battle Trance
equipment.description: Battle Trance is the priority when it comes to Chaos Armor. This is a staple for most builds, but is especially powerful here since it provides a bunch of Frenzy ranks alongside its other great stats. The implicit that grants 30% Resistances to All Elements makes it a great defensive choice as well.

equipment.name: Tibault's Will
equipment.description: Sabre of Tsasgal should replace either Paingorger's Gauntlets or Tibault's Will if you happen to find it - both of these are merely placeholders at this progression stage.

equipment.name: Grandfather
equipment.description: The The Grandfather is used in this setup to help maximize damage. The massive boost to our Maximum Life substantially increases our defensive capabilities, and its Unique effect serves as a permanent 2x damage multiplier since we have 100% Critical Strike Chance. All of the stats on this item benefit us in some way, especially the Maximum Fury, making it a very good addition to the build.

equipment.name: Fists of Fate
equipment.description: Many of the Uniques used in the Ancestral version of the build are still present here, but they have been upgraded to their Chaos Armor counterparts. There are some new additions as well:Sabre of Tsasgal, the weapon that puts emphasis on using multiple attack skills for a stacking damage buff. This task is easily accomplished just by equipping Dual Threat.Fists of Fate has great stats all around and provides an 80% damage multiplier on average. It also gives us extremely reliable Vulnerable application, as well as a ton of Lucky Hit Chance to ensure that the Battle Trance buff never falls off.

equipment.name: Sabre of Tsasgal
equipment.description: Sabre of Tsasgal, the weapon that puts emphasis on using multiple attack skills for a stacking damage buff. This task is easily accomplished just by equipping Dual Threat.

equipment.name: Violent Hammer of the Ancients
equipment.description: Violent Hammer of the Ancients is swapped in at this point for some extra damage, though it is technically a flex slot. Ground Stomp, Steel Grasp or any other utility skill are viable options as well.

title: Chain Lightning Sorcerer Leveling GuideBy pandaglassjaw | Last Updated: September 23, 2025Season 10   Infernal ChaosLevelingSorcerer

equipment.name: Critical Strike Chance
equipment.description: ‍Cem + ‍Gar provides additional Critical Strike Chance after evading and is a great generic option to increase damage and create more Crackling Energy from ‍Destructive Chain Lightning.

equipment.name: Primordial Binding
equipment.description: ‍Cir + ‍Ceh provides additional summons that Freeze enemies and apply Vulnerable. These also activate ‍Primordial Binding for mobility and Mana Regeneration.

equipment.name: Shocking Impact
equipment.description: ‍Tun triggers ‍Shocking Impact for a large burst of damage. This is the highest damage potential once you have enough ranks of ‍Shocking Impact and plenty of movement speed to replace ‍Qua.

equipment.name: Invocation Runes
equipment.description: ‍Tec for extra damage, with this you creates an earthquake and has the highest damage potential for early Invocation Runes.

equipment.name: Ritual Runes
equipment.description: ‍Yax and ‍Poc are other options for Ritual Runes.

title: Shadowblight Necromancer Endgame Build GuideBy MacroBioBoi | Last Updated: September 26, 2025Season 10   Infernal ChaosEndgameNecromancer

equipment.name: Godslayer Crown
equipment.description: Godslayer Crown - Duriel, King of Maggots, Andariel

title: Fleshrender Druid Endgame Build GuideBy Danger | Last Updated: September 27, 2025Season 10   Infernal ChaosEndgameDruid

equipment.name: The Fleshrender Druid
equipment.description: The Fleshrender Druid cannot be played without a Fleshrender. As such, prioritize obtaining this item from Lord Zir, with an emphasis on Ancestral versions with high unique effects. If you're having difficulty defeating this Boss, remember to lower your Torment tier for an easier fight.If possible, try to obtain a multi-GA version of this item as all its stats are desirable, or a Chaos Armor variant, preferably your Boots.

equipment.name: Chaos Armor
equipment.description: If possible, try to obtain a multi-GA version of this item as all its stats are desirable, or a Chaos Armor variant, preferably your Boots.

equipment.name: Wild Transformations
equipment.description: The other requirements, Que and Wild Transformations, can be obtained from Rune Tributes and leveling up your Seasonal Reputation Track, respectively. Dire Wolf's is a drop-only Aspect and is best farmed by gambling Boots with Obols. Once you've acquired the core components for this build, you essentially are close to the final version. The addition of other Uniques / Chaos Uniques from this point are build-enhancing.

equipment.name: Tibault's Will
equipment.description: Tibault's Will offers a healthy amount of All Stats and Damage Reduction, mainly paired with Grizzly Rage's Unstoppable for a solid damage multiplier. This unique can be obtained from Duriel, King of Maggots and/or Andariel.

equipment.name: Malefic Crescent
equipment.description: Malefic Crescent boasts a fantastic range of stats and a big damage multiplier. This item drops from Lord Zir and Urivar. Lastly, Tempest Roar comes with some Spirit generating capabilities, but is mainly used to transform Cyclone Armor into a Werewolf skill, improving its damage. You can find this unique from Duriel, King of Maggots and/or Andariel.

equipment.name: From the
equipment.description: From the time you reach Thunderstruck in your Paragon Board, be mindful of your Damage vs. Close and Damage vs. Distant bonus. The target for this stat is 300%, and your personal value will depend on the nodes taken on this board and the level of your Earth and Sky Glyph.

equipment.name: Sky Glyph
equipment.description: The target for this stat is 300%, and your personal value will depend on the nodes taken on this board and the level of your Earth and Sky Glyph.

equipment.name: Shroud of False Death
equipment.description: Shroud of False Death is an excellent addition, as its +1 to All Passive skills implicit is a massive offensive and defensive boon. On top of that, this Mythic comes with a very large amount of Willpower which is beneficial to Fleshrender's multiplier.

equipment.name: Fleshrender's
equipment.description: On top of that, this Mythic comes with a very large amount of Willpower which is beneficial to Fleshrender's multiplier.

equipment.name: Ring of Starless Skies
equipment.description: Ring of Starless Skies gives you a sizeable amount of Attack Speed and Lucky Hit Chance, both powerful stats for your build. Its unique effect is a very potent damage increase that also reduces the Spirit cost of your Shred.

equipment.name: All Chaos Armors
equipment.description: All Chaos Armors are available from Bartuc, or Obol gambling.

equipment.name: Earthen Bulwark
equipment.description: Earthen Bulwark is your main damage dealer, due to its incredibly short cast time and Werebear Overpower synergies when paired with Vasily's Prayer.

equipment.name: Defensive Skills
equipment.description: Petrify is used to reset your Defensive Skills instantly. The focus of the variant is primarily on resetting Petrify as fast and as often as possible, to supply your Fleshrender with numerous Defensive Skill casts. As a result, it's a very spam heavy build, requiring you to cast your skills as they come off Cooldown for optimal damage.Ensure your Petrify Cooldown is sub 10 seconds for Supreme Petrify, allowing you to spam it against Bosses. You can meet this threshold using Ultimate Cooldown Reduction and Petrify Cooldown Reduction Tempers, alongside Vehement Brawler's. For more information consult the gear above.

equipment.name: Petrify Cooldown
equipment.description: Ensure your Petrify Cooldown is sub 10 seconds for Supreme Petrify, allowing you to spam it against Bosses. You can meet this threshold using Ultimate Cooldown Reduction and Petrify Cooldown Reduction Tempers, alongside Vehement Brawler's. For more information consult the gear above.

equipment.name: While Fleshrender
equipment.description: While Fleshrender has no natural way to Overpower, you use Zan and Petrify to generate large amounts of Offering for Xan, resulting in very frequent Overpowers. Pair Qax with Yul in your other Runeword to take advantage of Petrify's large Spirit generation for even more damage.

equipment.name: Pair Qax
equipment.description: Pair Qax with Yul in your other Runeword to take advantage of Petrify's large Spirit generation for even more damage.

equipment.name: Fists of Fate
equipment.description: Calm Before the Storm is essential in reducing the Cooldown of your Petrify against regular monster packs. Use Wind Shear as your primary tool to activate it, since it boasts a very high Lucky Hit Chance when paired with Fists of Fate, pierces and multi-hits enemies, and can be cast from a distance to not interfere with Nature's Reach during combat. Additionally, Wind Shear helps with the lack of Movement Speed on Chaos Armor Boots, by increasing your Movement speed with Fierce Wind Shear.

equipment.name: Wind Shear
equipment.description: Additionally, Wind Shear helps with the lack of Movement Speed on Chaos Armor Boots, by increasing your Movement speed with Fierce Wind Shear.

equipment.name: Use Blessed Guide
equipment.description: Use Blessed Guide, Reddamine Buzz and Soothing Spices Incenses for more Willpower, Maximum Life, Armor, and to cap Resistances.

equipment.name: Consume Elixir of Advantage
equipment.description: Consume Elixir of Advantage II for extra Attack Speed and Lucky Hit Chance, both useful in activating your Calm Before the Storm more often. If you find yourself needing more survivability, opt for Elixir of Fortitude II instead of  Elixir of Advantage II.

equipment.name: Elixir of Fortitude
equipment.description: If you find yourself needing more survivability, opt for Elixir of Fortitude II instead of  Elixir of Advantage II.

title: Hydra Sorcerer Endgame Build GuideBy Northwar | Last Updated: September 25, 2025Season 10   Infernal ChaosEndgameSorcerer

equipment.name: Tal Rasha's Iridescent Loop
equipment.description: Tal Rasha's Iridescent Loop - Echo of Varshan

equipment.name: Primordial Binding
equipment.description: ‍Cir + ‍Ceh provides additional summons that Freeze enemies and apply Vulnerable. These also activate ‍Primordial Binding for mobility and Mana Regeneration.

equipment.name: Critical Strike Chance
equipment.description: ‍Gar provides additional Critical Strike Chance and is a great generic option.

equipment.name: Shocking Impact
equipment.description: ‍Tun triggers ‍Shocking Impact for a large burst of damage. This has high damage potential once you have enough ranks of ‍Shocking Impact and plenty of movement speed to replace ‍Qua.

equipment.name: Invocation Runes
equipment.description: ‍Tec for extra damage, with this you creates an earthquake and has the highest damage potential for early Invocation Runes.

title: Stinger Spiritborn Endgame Build GuideBy Wudijo | Last Updated: September 22, 2025Season 10   Infernal ChaosEndgameSpiritborn
Whirlwind Barbarian Endgame Build GuideBy aoinomiku | Last Updated: September 25, 2025Season 10   Infernal ChaosEndgameBarbarian

equipment.name: Gohr's Devastating Grips
equipment.description: Gohr's Devastating Grips - Echo of Varshan

equipment.name: Tibault's Will
equipment.description: Tibault's Will - Duriel, King of Maggots, Andariel
